str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
To speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist). From anti and lego; to dispute, refuse.
